org.phantomapi.chromatic

Class ChromaticBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phantomapi.chromatic.ChromaticBlock

  • public class ChromaticBlock
extends Object
    Chromatic blocks used to represent a block TYPE not an actual block at a location. Used for color and transparency properties
    Author:
    cyberpwn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChromaticBlock(MaterialBlock type)
      Create a chromatic block.

      • ChromaticBlock

        public ChromaticBlock(MaterialBlock type)
        Create a chromatic block. Must fill data to use (use Chromatic.getBlock(MaterialBlock) for a pre-created version)
        Parameters:
        type - the materialblock type

      • getTransparency

        public double getTransparency(org.bukkit.util.Vector direction)
        Get the estimated transparancy of a block of this type when looked at from the given vector angle
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction looked ad
        Returns:
        the transparency (0 being invisible, 1 being opaque)

      • getEffectiveColor

        public Color getEffectiveColor(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                               org.bukkit.util.Vector direction)
        Get the effective color from the position seen. This uses raytracing and applies colorblending depending on the transparency of the blocks. This will only blend to a maximum of 4 blocks deep
        Parameters:
        block - the block looked at
        direction - the direction looked at the block
        Returns:
        the effective color

      • getRelative

                                  org.bukkit.util.Vector direction)
        Get the relative chromatic block type based on the looked at block and direction
        Parameters:
        block - the block
        direction - the direction
        Returns:
        the chromatic block

      • getAlphaColor

        public Color getAlphaColor(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Get the color when viewed at a single direct face including transparency values as alpha in the color object
        Parameters:
        face - the face
        Returns:
        the color which may include alpha depending on transparency or null
